perturbation.original_text:
3.
Non-Solicitation. Section 4 of the Non-Competition Agreement is hereby deleted in its entirety and replaced with
the following:
“Term. This Agreement will become effective on the Effective Date, and will continue until the expiration of the “Sales
Term” as that term is defined in the Sales Dealer Agreement dated as of August 16, 2017 between Vivint and Vivint Solar
Developer, LLC (the “Term”).”
perturbation.changed_text:
3.
Non-Solicitation. Section 4 of the Non-Competition Agreement is hereby deleted in its entirety and replaced with
the following:
“Term. This Agreement will become effective on the Effective Date. The non-solicitation term will continue indefinitely, unless both Parties mutually agree in writing to terminate it earlier. The details regarding termination will be subject to a separate agreement.”
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly defines the term of the non-solicitation agreement by referencing the Sales Dealer Agreement. The modified version contradicts this by stating that the non-solicitation term continues indefinitely unless mutually terminated, creating uncertainty about the agreement's end date. This makes it difficult to determine when the non-solicitation obligations cease to apply.

perturbation.original_text:
4.
Continuation.
This Amendment will apply and be effective only with respect to the provisions of the Non-
Competition Agreement specifically referred to herein. Except as otherwise set forth in this Amendment, the Non-Competition

perturbation.changed_text:
4.
Continuation.
This Amendment may apply to provisions not specifically referred to herein at the discretion of Vivint Solar. Even if not explicitly modified, sections of the Non-Competition Agreement may be subject to reinterpretation based on current business needs. Except as ambiguously stated in this Amendment, the Non-Competition Agreement may continue with revisions.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states that the Amendment only applies to specifically referenced provisions, maintaining the original agreement's integrity. The modified text introduces uncertainty by granting Vivint Solar discretion to apply the amendment to unreferenced provisions and hinting at potential reinterpretations based on 'current business needs'. This contradicts the original intent of preserving the agreement's original terms and creates ambiguity.
